title: St James's Place rethinks staff bonuses
text:
The boss of St James’s Place has admitted it is rethinking its bonus scheme as the financial advice firm battles intense criticism over client fees and its close links to disgraced fund manager Neil Woodford.

Andy Croft defended pay-outs to staff who bring in large amounts of business, but said the firm is looking again at whether some perks are appropriate.

It comes after a huge backlash over foreign trips and other gifts lavished on staff who bring in customers for the firm, which looks after £112.8bn of savers' money.

Mr Croft was speaking as the company revealed it was handed an extra £2.1bn by customers in the third quarter of 2019, down 14.5pc from a year earlier.
